00026 #include <FdoStd.h>
00027 #include <fdo/Xml/Serializable.h>
00028 #include <fdo/Commands/Schema/PhysicalSchemaMapping.h>
00029 #include <fdo/Xml/ClassMappingCollection.h>
00030 
00031 /// \brief
00032 /// FdoXmlSchemaMapping specifies overrides for translating a feature schema between 
00033 /// FDO and GML.
00034 class FdoXmlSchemaMapping :
00035     public FdoPhysicalSchemaMapping
00036 {
00037  
00038 public:
00039     /// \brief
00040     /// Creates an XML Schema Mapping Set.
00041     /// 
00042     /// \return
00043     /// FdoXmlSchemaMapping
00044     /// 
00045     FDO_API static FdoXmlSchemaMapping* Create( GisString* name );
00046 
00047     /// \brief
00048     /// Gets the provider name.
00049     /// 
00050     /// \return
00051     /// Returns "Autodesk.GML.1.0". 
00052     /// \note
00053     /// This is the name given to this
00054     /// particular type of Schema Override set and is not the name of an actual FDO provider.
00055     /// 
00056     ///  
00057     FDO_API virtual GisString* GetProvider();
00058 
00059     /// \brief
00060     /// Sets the target namespace URI for the GML version of this schema.
00061     /// When the Feature Schema for these overrides is written to GML, its targetNamespace
00062     /// is set to this value.
00063     /// 
00064     /// \param url 
00065     /// Input the target namespace.
00066     /// 
00067     FDO_API void SetTargetNamespace( GisString* url );
00068 
00069     /// \brief
00070     /// Gets the target namespace URI for the GML version of this schema.
00071     /// 
00072     /// \return
00073     /// Returns the target namespace.
00074     /// 
00075     FDO_API GisString* GetTargetNamespace();
00076 
00077     /// \brief
00078     /// Gets the mappings between GML global elements and their types as Fdo Classes. These
00079     /// mappings are used in two circumstances:
00080     /// <ul>
00081     ///     <li> when features are read from a GML Document, these mappings determine the Feature
00082     ///     class of each feature, based on its element name. If the element name is not 
00083     ///     in these mappings then the class name defaults to the element name.
00084     ///     <li> when the Feature Schema for these overrides is written to GML, a global element
00085     ///     is created from each item in element mappings collection. 
00086     /// </ul>
00087     /// 
00088     /// \return
00089     /// Returns FdoXmlElementMappingCollection*
00090     /// 
00091     FDO_API FdoXmlElementMappingCollection* GetElementMappings();
00092 
00093     /// \brief
00094     /// Gets the mappings for FDO Classes.
00095     /// 
00096     /// \return
00097     /// Returns FdoXmlClassMappingCollection*
00098     /// 
00099     FDO_API FdoXmlClassMappingCollection* GetClassMappings();
00100 
00101 protected:
00102 /// \cond DOXYGEN-IGNORE
00103     FdoXmlSchemaMapping() {}
00104 
00105     FdoXmlSchemaMapping( GisString* name );
00106 
00107     virtual ~FdoXmlSchemaMapping();
00108 
00109     virtual void Dispose();
00110 
00111     /// Functions for XML support
00112 
00113     /// \brief
00114     /// Initializes this Xml Schema Mapping from its XML attributes. Called when
00115     /// the element is deserialized from XML. 
00116     /// 
00117     /// \param pContext 
00118     /// Input context contain information about the current deserialization operation
00119     /// \param attrs 
00120     /// Input the XML attributes.
00121     /// 
00122     /// \return
00123     /// Returns nothing
00124     /// 
00125     virtual void InitFromXml(GisXmlSaxContext* pContext, GisXmlAttributeCollection* attrs);
00126 
00127     /// \brief
00128     /// Writes this XML Schema Mapping to XML. Called when
00129     /// the element is serialized to XML. 
00130     /// 
00131     /// \param xmlWriter 
00132     /// Input write the element to this XML writer
00133     /// \param flags 
00134     /// Input flags that control the writing of the element.
00135     /// 
00136     /// \return
00137     /// Returns nothing
00138     /// 
00139     virtual void _writeXml(
00140         GisXmlWriter* xmlWriter, 
00141         const FdoXmlFlags* flags
00142     );
00143 /// \endcond
00144 
00145 private:
00146     GisStringP mTargetNamespace;
00147     FdoXmlElementMappingsP mElementMappings;
00148     FdoXmlClassMappingsP mClassMappings;
00149 };
00150 
00151 /// \brief
00152 /// FdoXmlSchemaMappingP is a GisPtr on FdoXmlSchemaMapping, provided for convenience.
00153 typedef GisPtr<FdoXmlSchemaMapping> FdoXmlSchemaMappingP;
00154 
00155 #endif
